title: Key Glock Explains Why He Doesn’t Work w/ Other Rappers, Talks Yellow Tape 2, 3-D Billboard + More
author: Dirty Glove Bastard
description:
Key Glock "Off The Porch" Interview

Last week we sat down with Key Glock for an exclusive “Off The Porch” interview! During our discussion he talked about going to Times Square to see his new 3-D billboard, his new album ‘Yellow Tape 2’, hitting #1 on Apple Music rap charts, plan to drop “Channel 5” music video, owning 9 yellow cars & trucks, the inspiration for his song “Juicemane”, explains why he doesn’t put any features on his albums, his chemistry with producer Bandplay, the intro song “Something Bout Me”, growing up in South Memphis, his relationship with his mother, growing up without her, jumping off the porch when he was 6, his teacher trying to whoop him in school, overcoming the struggle, remaining humble, recording since he was 15, working with Gucci Mane who was one of his biggest influences, not chasing clout or doing gimmicks, the music scene in Memphis right now, rappers in the city having to choose sides, Project Pat reaching out to work with him, explains how his single “Russian Cream” was created, people saying he sounded like Young Dolph when he first started rapping, touring overseas, chemistry working with Dolph, reveals why he remained independent, reveals why he doesn’t plan any new music next year, buying a McLaren when he turned 21, and much more!


Key Glock

"Off The Porch" is Dirty Glove Bastard's exclusive interview series where artists, producers, DJs & industry insiders are given a platform to tell their unfiltered story. Dirty Glove Bastard was created in 2007 to shine more light on the buzzing, regional music scenes in the South & Midwest.

localize.title: キー・グロックが他のラッパーと仕事をしない理由を説明し、Yellow Tape 2、3-D Billboardなどについて語りました。
Key Glock解释他为什么不与其他说唱歌手合作，谈论Yellow Tape 2，3-D Billboard + 更多
